message: Good *Freely* Available Textbooks on Machine Learning, nice collective page: http://metaoptimize.com/qa/questions/186/good-freely-available-textbooks-on-machine-learning -- amazed to see the standard textbook listed there, The Elements of Statistical Machine Learning by Hastie et al.

Jason Brownlee crawls Wikipedia for algorithms: http://www.neverreadpassively.com/2011/03/computational-intelligence-on-wikipedia.html -- "What sucks is that each article gets such a high ranking in a Google search result, although the quality is generally so poor."
"Mining of Massive Datasets" by Anand Rajaraman -- book used at Stanford, graduate level: http://infolab.stanford.edu/~ullman/mmds/book.pdf (2M, 340 pages).
Yahoo has a ML research group... some recent publications: http://research.yahoo.com/Machine_Learning
